page.title: 05The Coffee Morning.
page.content: On{Tuesday, 21st May}we arranged a{ {Coffee Morning}in school for the old people of Seaton Delaval. About 25 people came and were interviewed in groups. We showed them around school, and many who had attended this school were amazed at the changes they noticed. One lady,{Mrs. Ethel Newton said that the most expensive thing she had ever bought was a dining room suite which is now 44 years old. She bought it at the Co-operative Society at the Avenue Head. Their favourite {sweets}were aniseed balls, gobstoppers and chocolate mice. The thing that sticks in my mind from the Coffee Morning was that at night, Mrs. Newton told us that she and her friends would walk up to the Avenue Head and sit and chat together. The corner where they met was called{Dicky Bird Corner!}We kept a Visitors Book of the day.
